cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Mirin, Held by the Heavens dies, if your life total is less than 10, it becomes 10.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Adored by the heavens and revered by her brethren, Mirin acts as a conduit between realms and a proponent of peace among all.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever you cast a spell, if it isn't your main phase, create a 1/1 white Monk creature token, then creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“One is all, and all is one. Know this, and you will never be alone.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Syrina, the Dragon Queen enters, gain control of target nonland permanent for as long as you control Syrina, the Dragon Queen.
{2}{U}: Exile Syrina, the Dragon Queen. Return her to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.

You may activate loyalty abilities of target planeswalker you control an additional time this turn.
Fabled {1}{U}{U} [i](Then if you cast this for its fabled cost, put it onto the battlefield transformed attached to that planeswalker.)[/i]
cards.rules_text2:
Enchant planeswalker
Enchanted planeswalker has “[+2]: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.”
cards.flavor_text2: [i]When Hemley saw who he had truly been traveling with, he realized he liked the hat's company rather more than Egil's anyway.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Deathtouch
Instant and sorcery spells you control have deathtouch.
{2}{B}: Exile target creature card from an opponent's graveyard, then create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token and put a +1/+1 counter on Saffrisa, Heir Apparent.
Whenever Ravaging Tyrant enters or attacks, each opponent loses 3 life, discards a card, and sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“You live only because I let you.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Haste
[i]Dominance[/i] — {T}: Create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying. Activate only if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.
Target opponent sacrifices half the permanents they control, rounded down.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Some grudges are so strong that the world must burn to sate them.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 2.
Reveal the top card of your library: If a creature card with flying was revealed this way, Imperial Chimera gains flying until end of turn. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, reach, trample, and vigilance.

Flash
If a spell or ability an opponent controls would cause you to discard a creature card, you may put that card onto the battlefield instead.

Tap target nonland permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
Put target permanent into its owner's library second from the top.
Shuffle up to X cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards. You gain that much life.
cards.special_text:
[-1]: Tap target nonland permanent. It doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
[-2]: Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library second from the top.
[-X]: Shuffle up to X cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards. You gain that much life.

cards.rules_text: Search target opponent's library for a creature or planeswalker card and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.special_text:
[+1]: Move a counter from up to one target permanent onto another permanent that shares a type with it.
[-1]: Target creature gets -1/-3 until end of turn.
[-5]: Search target opponent's library for a creature or planeswalker card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles.

[+2]: Create a 3/3 red Panda creature token.
[-X]: Sacrifice a creature. If you do, search your library for a creature card with mana value less than or equal to X plus the sacrificed creature's mana value. Put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
[-6]: You get an emblem with “Whenever a creature dies, this emblem deals damage equal to that creature's power to any target and you draw that many cards.”

[+1]: Distribute two +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures you control.
[-1]: Create two 1/1 white Monk creature tokens.
[-6]: Until your next turn, you choose which creatures attack or block and how those creatures attack or block.

cards.rules_text:
Target creature gets +X/+X and gains trample until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.
Fabled {4}{R}{G} [i](Then if you cast this for its fabled cost, put it onto the battlefield transformed attached to that creature.)[/i]

First strike
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I can counter every trick you know, and many more besides. Let's just move on to the part where you give up, yeah?”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, if you gained 4 or more life this turn, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The heavens part to touch the mundane only to stymie the most horrible havoc—or to reward the most selfless souls.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Double strike
{3}{W}: Arm target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery. [i](Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+0” and equip {2}, then attach it to that creature.)[/i]

Flash
When Issbarren Warden enters, exile target token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Leave behind everything you don't need. The Issbarrens are fickle on the best of days, and extra weight won't help that.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
Whenever an embattled creature you control attacks, tap target creature defending player controls. [i](A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it or has a permanent you control attached to it.)[/i]

Lifelink
Whenever Bjarndyr Sergeant attacks, other creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The choice is upon us! Live in shame, or die in glory!”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target opponent chooses up to one creature. Destroy the rest.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The village offered to the vengeful vikings an innocent scapegoat to sate their bloodlust. She alone survived.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains indestructible until end of turn.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has “You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.”
cards.flavor_text2:
[i]“The heavens parted, the angel braced for battle, and all knew that to fight further was futile.”
—Hemley Eggfeather[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Enchant creature
As Equanimity enters, choose a card type.
When Equanimity enters, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen card type. This effect doesn't remove Equanimity. [i](This permanent can't be targeted, dealt damage, enchanted, or equipped by anything with that card type.)[/i]

Flash
When Cane Dancer enters, you may cast target blue instant or sorcery card with mana value 2 from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.

Flying
If a triggered ability of another permanent you control would trigger for the first time each turn, that ability triggers an additional time.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Its warbles carry through the wind, creating an echo far more solid than mere sound.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{8}{U}{U}: Monstrosity 5. [i](If this creature isn't monstrous, put five +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)[/i]
When Shipway Whale becomes monstrous, target player exiles all cards in their library, then shuffles their graveyard into their library.

Flying
When Syrina's Brood enters, look at the top six cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“A pale parody though it may be, it is still born of dragon souls—and so, it is still my child.”
—Syrina, Dragon Queen[/i]

cards.rules_text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. You may put a permanent card that shares a card type with it from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Issbarrens claim what they will, but not always without recompense.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature to its owner's hand unless that player pays {1}.
• Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {1}.

Target opponent reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal two instant and/or sorcery cards. Exile those cards, then that player shuffles the rest into their library. You may cast cards exiled this way until end of turn, and you may cast them without paying their mana costs.
Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may have you put those cards into your hand. Otherwise, put those cards into your graveyard, then draw three cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Their world bereft of recourse from the undead, the Culi-Sae reached out beyond it.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Create a token that's a copy of target creature you control.

Enchant creature you control

cards.flavor_text2:

—Hemley Eggfeather[/i]

cards.rules_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay 1 life.
Departed Evangel can't block.
You may cast Departed Evangel from your graveyard if a creature died this turn.

Sacrifice two other creatures: Monstrosity 2. [i](If this creature isn't monstrous, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)[/i]
When Flailing Terror becomes monstrous, target opponent sacrifices two creatures.
When Astrid, Disgruntled Princess enters, destroy target creature with mana value less than or equal to the number of Warriors you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Saffrisa's conquest will raze this world and let Skhorvall starve in the ashes. Either she dies, or we do.”[/i]
cards.notes: “Saffrisa's forsaken what it means to be Skhorvall. You who would still live our strength, come and crush her with me.”

cards.rules_text:
Menace
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Skhorvall Behemoth gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The curses of the dead cling to their killers, attracting misfortune and calamity—and a giant's lifetime holds many murders.[/i]

Deathtouch

cards.rules_text:
Flying, lifelink
Skip your draw step.
Pay 3 life: Draw three cards. Activate only as a sorcery and only once each turn.
Search your library for a card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top. You lose life equal to its mana value.
cards.flavor_text:

cards.rules_text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker. You gain 1 life and that permanent's controller loses 1 life.

cards.rules_text: [i]Dominance[/i] — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power, you may pay {R}. cards.flavor_text: [i]“No more holding back. No more mercy. Either they die, or we do.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Exchange control of all creatures you and target player control until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The night, the blood, the pain, the fear—all together snapped their minds, and a unified front became an indiscriminate massacre.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]He told himself he was just living to fight another day—but by the trembling of his hands, he knew he would never return.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target attacking creature gains double strike until end of turn. Arm it. [i](Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+0” and equip {2}, then attach it to that creature.)[/i]
Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The citadel had taken years of work from human, bear, and fox alike to complete. It was a stalwart testament to the Rakkiri's ideals of peace and coexistence—but in the end, it burned like so much firewood.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library, then draw two cards.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I was meant to fight the bears that night, but the forest's lights led me astray. The life that would've ended in a hopeless battle, I now devote to the wild that saved it.”
—Jarindr, hermit druid[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Break their armor first, or you'll never bring them down!”[/i]

[i]“The perfect prey. Flesh for meat, fur for cloaks, hide for armor, tusks for weapons. Why hunt anything else?”
